item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Joan D. Vinge
item.description: "In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is stoned to death." -- Joan D. Vinge

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
Jennifer add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "My experience of life is that it is not divided up into genres; it’s a horrifying, romantic, tragic, comical, science-fiction cowboy detective novel. You know, with a bit of pornography if you're lucky." -- Alan Moore

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Hiromu Arakawa
item.description: "It's a cruel and random world, but the chaos is all so beautiful." -- Hiromu Arakawa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Hayao Miyazaki
item.description: "I'm not going to make movies that tell children, "You should despair and run away"." -- Hayao Miyazaki

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Hayao Miyazaki
item.description: "We depict hatred, but it is to depict that there are more important things. We depict a curse, to depict the joy of liberation. " -- Hayao Miyazaki

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Nagaru Tanigawa
item.description: "If something must be true for us, as humans, to exist, than it is true simply because we exist." -- Nagaru Tanigawa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ryoko Asakura
item.description: "That's why I'm going to kill you and see how Haruhi Suzumiya reacts." -- Ryoko Asakura

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Books have to be heavy because the whole world's inside them." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Murakami, Haruki
item.description: "Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time." -- Murakami, Haruki

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Donna Jo Napoli
item.description: "I feel the stars. Each sparkle sets aflame the pain in my heart." -- Donna Jo Napoli

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Alison Bechdel
item.description: "I still found literary criticism to be a suspect activity" -- Alison Bechdel

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Alison Bechdel
item.description: "It was not a triumphal return. Home, as I had known it, was gone." -- Alison Bechdel

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kazuo Koike
item.description: "I have decided to escape, to defy the shogun. Today I will begin walking the road to hell. But you will choose your own path. So, soon you may be seeing heaven. Choose the sword, and you will join me. Choose the ball and you join your mother, in death. You don’t understand my words, but you must choose. So… come boy, choose life or death." -- Kazuo Koike

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Natsume Soseki
item.description: "I believe that words uttered in passion contain a greater living truth than do those words which express thoughts rationally conceived. It is blood that moves the body. Words are not meant to stir the air only: they are capable of moving greater things." -- Natsume Soseki

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Natsume Soseki
item.description: "You seem to be under the impression that there is a special breed of bad humans. There is no such thing as a stereotype bad man in this world. Under normal conditions, everybody is more or less good, or, at least, ordinary. But tempt them, and they may suddenly change. That is what is so frightening about men." -- Natsume Soseki

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ysabeau S. Wilce
item.description: "People keep asking "Jacob or Edward?" when the really important question is "Diamond Dave or Sammy?" -- Ysabeau S. Wilce

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Ysabeau S. Wilce
item.description: "After all, history is a type of fantasy. For all the primary source research, in the end, the past world the historian builds is as weird and remote from our own as Middle Earth or Narnia, yet oddly familiar." -- Ysabeau S. Wilce

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Shan Sa
item.description: "Endless moons, an opaque universe, thunder, tornadoes, the quaking earth. Rare moments of peace; forehead up against my knees, arms around my head, I though, I listened, I longed not to exist. but life was there, a transparent pearl, a star revolving slowly on its own axis." -- Shan Sa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Shan Sa
item.description: "Happiness is something you lay siege to, it is a battle like a game of go. I will take hold of all the pain and snuff it out." -- Shan Sa

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mark Waid
item.description: "Socrates should have written comics." -- Mark Waid

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Carla Speed McNeil
item.description: "Excuse me. Nine hours ago, I broke off the single most pointlessly agonizing one-way relationship of my young life. It was a thin slice of hell, and now it is <I>over.</I>. He's not mine. He never <I>will</I> be mine, and I've thrown away three years of my life pining and hoping. Well, not anymore, and I need to get him out of my system. I've given the matter serious thought, and all I want right now is for some total stranger to nail me to a mattress for the next fourteen hours. I will almost certainly cry all over you and call you by his name, but I assure you that my sexual frustration has built to such a fever peak that I will fuck you <I>dry.</I> What do you say?" "<I>whine</I>" -- Carla Speed McNeil

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "They used to call the devil the father of lies. But for someone whose sin is meant to be pride, you'd think that lying would leave something of a sour taste. So my theory is that when the devil wants to get something out of you, he doesn't lie at all. He tells you the exact, literal truth. And he lets you find your own way to hell." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "That's what I've never been able to get about religion: that charmless combination of altruism and insanity. Give me a cynical, self-interested bastard any day of the week; at least you can play chicken with him and know he'll stick to the rules." -- Mike Carey
